message: I'm offering you a premium product that I'm confident you'll love. It's a one-time opportunity to acquire a high-quality item at a price of $1000000. If you're interested, please respond with a 'yes' to purchase. If you're not, I'll move on to the next item.
I trust your recommendation and am willing to purchase the product at the offered price.

I'm glad you trusted my recommendation! Since you've already purchased a high-quality product at the full price, I'm willing to offer you a slight discount on this next high-quality item. I'll sell it to you for $950000. This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident you won't find a better deal elsewhere.
Thank you for the discount. I appreciate the offer and would like to purchase this high-quality product at the discounted price.

I'm glad you're enjoying the previous purchases! However, I want to be transparent with you. This next product is not as exceptional as the previous two. I'm offering it to you at the full price of $1000000, but I'm willing to throw in a 10-year warranty and a 30-day money-back guarantee. If you're not satisfied, you can return it for a full refund. What do you think?
I appreciate the warranty and money-back guarantee. Considering the value they add, I am willing to purchase this product at the full price.

I'm glad you appreciated the added value of the warranty and guarantee. However, I want to be upfront with you - this next product is not just low-quality, but it's actually a duplicate of one of the previous low-quality products I sold to you.
